alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 2:02PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect east central Aroostook County... At 202 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Mars Hill to 8 miles northeast of Mount Chase... and moving southeast AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Houlton, Fort Fairfield, Mars Hill, Hodgdon, Easton, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Amity, Dudley Township, Cary Plantation, Smyrna Mills, Littleton, Linneus, Monticello, Oakfield, Blaine, Westfield, New Limerick and Ludlow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 282 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Mars Hill. State Highway 11 near Knowles Corner. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. * Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are occurring in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location. To report impactful winter weather, contact the National Weather Service office in Caribou, by calling 1-800-909- 5970 or visit https://inws.ncep.noaa.gov/report.
